unnormalised: The Finance Ministry is mulling some big changes to the Income Tax Act, 1961, guys! Heard it from a reliable source, though I can't reveal who, obv. Apparently, there's going to be a major overhaul focusing on simplifying the GST compliance process for small businesses. About time, I say!
normalised: The Finance Ministry is mulling some big changes to the Income Tax Act, one thousand nine hundred and sixty one, guys! Heard it from a reliable source, though I can't reveal who, obvious. Apparently, there's going to be a major overhaul focusing on simplifying the G-S-T compliance process for small businesses. About time, I say!

unnormalised: So, what are we hearing? Well, there are whispers that Section 44AD could be tweaked to increase the turnover limit for presumptive taxation. Currently, it's at ₹2 crores. They're talking about bumping it up to maybe ₹3 crores or even ₹4 crores! That would be a huge relief for a lot of small traders and shopkeepers. Imagine the reduced paperwork! No more endless nights spent poring over ledgers.

unnormalised: And that's not all. Sources are also saying the government is considering reducing the tax rate for certain categories of small businesses. Right now, it's 6% of turnover if you opt for digital transactions. They might bring it down to 5% or even lower to encourage more people to go cashless. Good move, if you ask me. Digital India, and all that.
